newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan rice prices seen rising in bullish mood.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan rice prices seen rising in bullish mood.

text.p: Pakistani rice export prices are recovering from brief dip this week amid a bullish mood in local markets, exporters said on Thursday.
"Prices have rebounded this week and are expected to rise next week," Javed Islam Agha, chairman of the Rice Exporters Association of Pakistan, told Reuters.

Super basmati rice, competing with India's best quality basmati, jumped to $625-$650 per tonne FOB from $610-$625 after Pakistan began exporting it to the European Union under new laws designed to ensure better quality, a dealer said.
The News newspaper said that a first shipment of 105 tonnes of super basmati had been shipped to Britain on Tuesday.
The dealer said prices would rise on expected higher exports to Gulf Arab states and Iraq, which some exporters said had bought unspecified quantities of rice from Pakistan.
Rice exports rose 83.24 percent to 217,876 tonnes worth $55 million in December from 118,899 worth $32 million in November.
In the first half of 1996/97 (July-June), rice exports rose 10.58 percent to 654,966 tonnes worth $195 million, compared to 592,300 tonnes worth $200 million in the year-ago period.
"Exports are likely to increase in the second half," the dealer said.

Prices of IRRI-6, which dipped this week, also firmed on higher demand from abroad and were expected to rise further after the government told the state-run Rice Export Corporation of Pakistan (RECP) to buy from cash-short farmers, he said.
He said big dealers were not buying large quantities from farmers in the belief that prices would fall.
The RECP sold its last stocks of 42,016 tonnes of IRRI-6 in an open auction at $238 per tonne CIF at the end of December.
The caretaker government has announced plans to merge it with the state-run Trading Corporation of Pakistan, but the decision has not yet been implemented.
Following are exporters weekly FOB rates per tonne:
Thursday Jan 9
Basmati super $625/650 $610/625
Following are domestic rates in rupees per 100 kg:
Thursday Jan 9
-- Karachi newsroom 9221-5685192
